Key Match Events: India win dramatic match by four wickets
Virat Kohli hits unbeaten 82 off 53 balls
Pakistan only used five bowlers, but the decision to leave Mohammad Nawaz's final over of spin until the last will be one that will, surely, haunt Babar Azam for a long time.
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan skipper Babar Azam: "It was a tight game but we started bowling well. Our bowlers bowled really well and credit to Kohli who finished the game and shifted the momentum."

India captain Rohit Sharma: "I have no words left as well! I think you have to expect something like this in a game like this. Our plan was to stay in the game as long as possible, that is what we have talked about, and keep believing you can pull through from whatever situation. That's what happened with that partnership between Hardik Pandya and Virat Kohli."
Player of the match Virat Kohli: "I have no words, no idea how that happened. I just kept believing and staying there until the end. I am honestly just lost for words."
Miscellaneous Highlights: This was the first T20 World Cup match between India and Pakistan in Australia.
Others: The match was played at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG).
